Description: Two fragments from the shoulder of a pottery à la brosse transport amphora with graffito: ΠΕΤ.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: Findspot determined by Petrie 1888, p. 60 § 57, pl. xxiv, 11. Cf. A. Johnston, 'ΠΕΤ: Food for Thought', ZPE 133, 2000, 236; J. Bingen, 'Le graffito archaïque Péluse 385 C.-M.', ZPE 130, 2000, 151; J. Y. Carrez-Maratray, Péluse et l'angle oriental du delta Egyptien aux époques grecque, romaine et byzantine (Cairo 1999), 193-194.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 60 § 57, p. 61 § 58, pl. xxiv, 11)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 59, XI.1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 291)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (p.26 fig.15, p.28 Table1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.128, p.129, p.213, p.226, pl.68)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 2010,5002.60 (incorrect number given on p.226 of Leclère and Spencer 2014)
